items.title: Live: Twelve major fires still burning in Victoria as number of buildings destroyed climbs
items.description: Firefighters continue to battle fires across the state after the grim news that a person had been found dead and at least 390,000 hectares burnt. Follow live.

items.title: 'Unheard of in a major developed economy': Criminal probe opens into US Fed Chair
items.description: The US attorney's office in the District of Columbia has opened a criminal investigation into Jerome Powell, the chair of the Federal Reserve.

items.title: PM recalls parliament to introduce hate speech and gun laws
items.description: Anthony Albanese has recalled parliament early to deal with sweeping hate speech and gun laws in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.

items.title: Federal minister backs axing of Palestinian author from writers' festival
items.description: Resources Minister Madeleine King's comments come amid a growing furore over the decision that has led several board members to resign and dozens of writers to withdraw from the Adelaide literary event.

items.title: Why Iran’s protests echo 1979 and why they’re different
items.description: Understanding how events unfold in Iran requires understanding how its society and economy have reconfigured in the 47 years since the Islamic revolution.

items.title: Live: Rose Byrne wins first Golden Globe, Jacob Elordi and Sarah Snook miss out
items.description: Australian actor Rose Byrne wins a Golden Globe for her performance in If I Had Legs I'd Kick You, while Jacob Elordi misses out for Frankenstein. Follow live.

items.title: Danish PM says Greenland feud at 'decisive moment' after new Trump threats
items.description: Donald Trump says controlling Greenland is crucial for US national security and he has suggested using force to seize the Arctic territory.

items.title: More than the US and UK, the Taliban has an issue with Australia
items.description: The Taliban's chief spokesman agreed to an unscripted, sit-down interview with me, there was just one non-negotiable condition, writes Meghna Bali.

items.title: Trump admin sending more agents to Minneapolis despite outrage over fatal shooting
items.description: US Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem says hundreds more federal agents are heading to Minneapolis, brushing aside demands by the city's Democratic leaders to leave after an immigration officer fatally shot a female protester.

items.title: 'The hero of Bondi Junction' stabbing attack diagnosed with rare cancer
items.description: NSW Police Inspector Amy Scott, who was praised for bringing the Westfield Bondi Junction stabbing attack to an end, has been diagnosed with a rare and aggressive form of breast cancer.

items.title: Walking through post-festival camp full of abandoned gear feels like 'shopping'
items.description: With campsite trash accounting for more than half of the rubbish accumulated at music festivals, there are calls for a "cultural shift" in the behaviour of those attending.

items.title: Live: ACCC reportedly to sue Coles, Woolies as US Fed chair faces criminal probe
items.description: US Federal Reserve chief Jerome Powell confirms he is facing a Department of Justice investigation, while Australia's competition watchdog will use new powers to go after the big supermarkets, according to a report.

items.title: 'Factories of hate': Overhaul aimed at shutting down illegal prayer halls
items.description: Sydney councils would be granted greater powers to shut down illegal prayer halls under proposed reforms by the NSW government.

items.title: Why there are no Michelin-starred restaurants in Australia
items.description: If you're a food lover, chances are you've heard of the Michelin Guide – you may have even dined at a Michelin-starred restaurant, but not here in Australia.

items.title: How 'hidden thoughts' can be a sign of OCD in some people
items.description: Everyone experiences intrusive thoughts, and most people can brush them off without a worry. But what happens when those intrusive thoughts become inescapable?

items.title: 'What can I do?' Sabalenka brushes off handshake snub
items.description: Marta Kostyuk explained that not shaking Aryna Sabalenka's hand and talking about Ukraine following her Brisbane International defeat was her duty, and to not highlight the issues at home would be "inhumane".

items.title: How I have fun with friends without spending money
items.description: I've kept low-cost, high-fun habits alive for years, even after returning home to a city where socialising often seems to mean shelling out.

items.title: Firefighters were tackling a blaze when a camera alerted them to an unseen threat
items.description: As fire crews were responding to two fires on Tasmania's east coast in December, an AI camera nestled in a nearby vantage point spotted a third blaze. The early detection meant the fire was extinguished just two hours later.

items.title: Man in custody after 17-year-old shot in South Hobart
items.description: A man is in custody, and a 17-year-old boy is in a critical but stable condition after being shot in Hobart overnight.

items.title: Flood risk grows as heavy rain batters Queensland after ex-Cyclone Koji moves inland
items.description: A severe weather warning for flash flooding is in place from Mackay to Gladstone and inland after several people were rescued from floodwater.

items.title: Ozempic-like drug to be listed on PBS for people with severe obesity
items.description: The cost of weight loss drug Wegovy will soon be massively subsidised for Australians with severe obesity who have had a stroke or heart attack.

items.title: Elite sportswomen have shared their stories, and these are the hard truths
items.description: Low pay, discrimination, disordered eating, sexism and online abuse are just a few of the prevalent issues ABC's Elite Athletes in Women's Sport Survey has revealed, despite recent progress in women's sport.

items.title: 'We can't survive it': The suburbs fighting against fast food giants
items.description: Nutrition, vibe and culture concerns fuel these communities that want to protect their suburbs' identity and businesses from the fast food giants.

items.title: Trump tells Cuba to 'make a deal' as US cuts off Venezuelan oil
items.description: The US is enforcing a strict oil blockade on Venezuela, the communist country's main supplier of oil, as the Trump administration continues to push Latin American countries to align with it.

items.title: 'These ICE agents are here for sport': Why immigration agents surged into Minneapolis
items.description: Minneapolis had been the target of a massive immigration enforcement operation in the weeks leading up to Renee Nicole Good's death. Now, the shooting has opened old wounds.
